results.definition: an essay (especially one written as an assignment)
to give an account or representation of in words
the act of informing by verbal report
examples: he heard reports that they were causing trouble

results.definition: a written evaluation of a student's scholarship and deportment
examples: his father signed his report card

results.definition: be responsible for reporting the details of, as in journalism
examples: Snow reported on China in the 1950's
The cub reporter covered New York City

results.definition: a short account of the news
a written document describing the findings of some individual or group
the general estimation that the public has for a person
examples: he was a person of bad report

results.definition: announce as the result of an investigation or experience or finding
examples: Dozens of incidents of wife beatings are reported daily in this city
The team reported significant advances in their research
I report to work every day at 9 o'clock

results.definition: a sharp explosive sound (especially the sound of a gun firing)
examples: they heard a violent report followed by silence

results.definition: complain about; make a charge against
examples: I reported her to the supervisor
One student reported the other to the principal
